requestedShipment.description: The shipment data describing the shipment being tendered to FedEx.

shipDatestamp.description:
This is the shipment date. Default value is current date in case the date is not provided or a past date is provided.
Format [YYYY-MM-DD].
Example: 2019-10-14

totalDeclaredValue.description: It is the sum of all declared values of all packages in a shipment. The amount of totaldeclaredValue must be equal to the sum of all the individual declaredValues in the shipment. The declaredValue and totalDeclaredValue must match in all currencies in one shipment. This value represents FedEx maximum liability associated with a shipment. This is including, but not limited to any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information related to the Shipment.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

shipper.description: Indicate the Shipper contact details for this shipment.

streetLines.description:
This is the combination of number, street name, etc. Maximum length per line is 35.
Example: 10 FedEx Parkway, Suite 302.

Note:

  • At least one line is required.
  • Streetlines more than 3 will be ignored.
  • Empty lines should not be included
  • For SmartPost Shipments, only 30 characters from the individual street lines will be printed on the labels.

city.description:
This is a placeholder for City Name.
Note: This is conditional and not required in all the requests.
Note: It is recommended for Express shipments for the most accurate ODA and OPA surcharges.
Example: Beverly Hills

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for state or province code.
Example: CA.
click here to see State or Province Code

postalCode.description:
This is the postal code.
Note: This is Optional for non postal-aware countries. Maximum length is 10.
Example: 65247
click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
This is the two-letter country code.
Maximum length is 2.
Example: US
click here to see Country codes

residential.description: Indicate whether this address is residential (as opposed to commercial).

address.description: This is detailed information on physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place to which one could go), or as a container of address parts which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US).

personName.description:
Specify contact name. Maximum length is 70.
Note: Either the companyName or personName is mandatory.
Example: John Taylor

emailAddress.description:
Specify contact email address. Maximum length is 80.
Example: sample@company.com

phoneExtension.description:
Specify contact phone extension. Maximum length is 6.
Example: 1234

phoneNumber.description:
Specify contact phone number.
Minimum length is 10 and supports Maximum as 15 for certain countries using longer phone numbers.
Note: Recommended Maximum length is 15 and there's no specific validation will be done for the phone number.
Example: 918xxxxx890

companyName.description:
Specify contact company name. Maximum length is 35.
Note: Either the companyName or personName is mandatory.

contact.description: Indicate the contact details for this shipment.

tins.description: This is the tax identification number details.

number.description:
Specify tax ID number. Maximum length is 18.
Example: 123567

tinType.description: Indicate the type of tax identification number.

usage.description: Specify the reason for using the tax identification number in shipment processing.

effectiveDate.description:

expirationDate.description:
Specify the tax ID expiration date.

packagingType.description:
Specify the packaging used.

Example: FEDEX_PAK
click here to see Package Types

totalWeight.description:
Indicate the shipment total weight in pounds.
Example: 10.6
Note:
  • This only applies to International shipments and should be used on the first package of a multiple piece shipment.
  • This value contains 1 explicit decimal position.
  • For one Label at a time shipments, the unit of totalWeight is considered same as the unit of weight provided in requestedPackageLineItem field.

Example:
  • HOLD_AT_LOCATION
  • RETURN_SHIPMENT
  • BROKER_SELECT_OPTION
  • CALL_BEFORE_DELIVERY
  • COD
  • CUSTOM_DELIVERY_WINDOW

attributes.description: Use this attribute to specify if the Trade documents will be uploaded post the shipment.

attachedDocuments.description: Use this object to specify the details regarding already uploded document(s). This object is required if the documents are uploaded Pre-Shipment uploaded documents. It is recommended to provide values for all elements under this object.

documentType.description: Specify document type for the uploaded document. It should match with the type of uploaded document associated with documentId.

documentReference.description:
Specify the reference for the uploaded document.This is for the customer to reference their uploaded docs when they retrieve them. Could be anything, order number, po number, whatever the customer used to tie the document to something they would use.
Note: Ensure to supply document references in case of Pre-Shipment document upload.

Example: Reference

description.description:
Specify additional information about the uploaded document for better understanding.
Example: Certificate of Origin is uploaded for country of manufacturing verification.

documentId.description:
This is the uploaded document ID value.
Example: 090927d680038c61

items.description: Specify the document upload reference details.

requestedDocumentTypes.description:
Indicate the types of shipping documents produced for the shipper by FedEx. The types of shipping documents are copied back to the shipper in the shipment result data.
Note: For more information document types, refer business overview topic - Shipping and Customs Documents.

etdDetail.description: Use this object to specify all information on how the electronic Trade document references used with the shipment.

merchantPhoneNumber.description:
This is the merchant phone number and required for Email Return Labels.
Example: 19012635656

allowedSpecialService.description:
Indicate the allowed (merchant-authorized) special services which may be selected when the subsequent shipment is created.
Only services represented in EmailLabelAllowedSpecialServiceType will be controlled by this list.

returnEmailDetail.description: These are email details for the return shipment.

reason.description:
Specify the reason for the return.
Note: There is no validation for reason. Recommended length is 60 alpha-numeric characters
Example: Wrong color or size.

rma.description:
This is a Return Merchant Authorization (RMA) for the return shipment.
Reason for the requirement is mandatory.

shipDatestamp.description:
This is the ship date for the outbound shipment associated with a return shipment. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.
Example: 2019-10-01

trackingNumber.description:
This is the tracking number associated with this package.
Example: 49XXX0000XXX20032835

returnAssociationDetail.description: Specifies the details of an outbound shipment in order to associate the return shipment to it.

returnType.description: This is the return Type. Required to be set to PRINT_RETURN_LABEL for printed return label shipments. For email return label shipments returnType must be set to PENDING and pendingShipmentDetail must be set to EMAIL.

returnShipmentDetail.description: Use this object for specifying return shipment details.

pendingShipmentType.description:

Not applicable for other types of shipments.

processingOptions.description: Use this object to allow the Email Label shipment originator,  specify if the Email label shipment completer can make modifications to editable shipment data.

types.description:
This is the recommended document Type.
click here to see shipment document type

recommendedDocumentSpecification.description: These are documents that are recommended to be included with the shipment.

emailAddress.description:
This is recipient email address for notifying the return label. Maximum length 200 characters.
Example: neena@abc.com

optionsRequested.description: These are to indicate how the email notifications for the pending shipment to be processed.

role.description: This is to specify Recipient role in the shipment.Shipment completor role is needed when we pass shipment initiator. We cannot use shipment initiator alone.

locale.description:
These are locale details.
Example: 'en_US'
click here to see locales
Note: If the locale is left blank or an invalid locale is entered, an error message is returned in response.

message.description: This is an optional personalized message to be included in the email to the recipient.

Example: PRO FORMA INVOICE

documentId.description:
This is the uploaded document ID value.
Example: 090927d680038c61

items.description: Specify the document upload reference details.

expirationTimeStamp.description:
This is the Email Label expiration date. The maximum expiration date for an Email Return Label must be greater of equal to the day of the label request and not greater than 2 years in the future.
Example: 2020-01-01

pendingShipmentDetail.description: This object is used to specify the Pending Shipment Type for Email label.

locationId.description:
This is an alphanumeric identifier used for Location/Facility Identification.
Example: YBZA
Note:
  • For HAL Shipment, Location ID is REQUIRED to ensure packages are delivered to the right location.
  • Use endpoint [Find Location] in [Location Search API], to find the correct location ID for your shipment.

If the shipper is requesting a special service which requires additional data (such as the COD amount), the shipment special service type must be present in the specialServiceTypes collection, and the supporting detail must be provided in the appropriate sub-object below.

termsOfSale.description:
Specify terms Of Sale that will be populated on the Commercial Invoice (or Pro Forma). Maximum length is 3
Valid values are:
  • FCA/FOB (Free Carrier/Free On Board): Seller is responsible for all costs of delivering goods to destination. (Default)
  • CIP (Costs, Insurance Paid): Seller is responsible for miscellaneous charges to destination.
  • CPT (Carriage Paid To): Buyer is responsible for insurance.
  • EXW (Ex Works): Seller makes goods available to buyer. Buyer is responsible for delivering goods to destination.
  • DDU (Delivered Duty Unpaid): Seller is responsible for delivering goods to destination. Buyer is responsible for clearing goods through Bureau of Customs and Border Protection.
  • DDP (Delivered Duty Paid): Seller is responsible for delivering goods to destination, including duties, taxes, and miscellaneous fees.
  • DAP (Delivered at Place): Seller pays for carriage to the named place, except for costs related to import clearance, and assumes all risks prior to the point that the goods are ready for unloading by the buyer.
  • DPU(Deliver at Place of Unloading)

type.description:
Specify the reason for a global return, as recognized by Customs. Valid values:
  • COURTESY_RETURN_LABEL: For the outbound courtesy return label.
  • EXHIBITION_TRADE_SHOW: For exhibition or trade-show, outbound and inbound.
  • FAULTY_ITEM: For faulty item being returned, inbound only.
  • FOLLOWING_REPAIR: For repaired or processed item being sent, outbound only.
  • FOR_REPAIR: For repair or processing, outbound and inbound.
  • ITEM_FOR_LOAN: For loan item, outbound and inbound.
  • OTHER: Other reason, outbound and inbound. This type requires a description.
  • REJECTED: For rejected merchandise being returned, inbound.
  • REPLACEMENT: For replacement being sent, outbound only.
  • TRIAL: For use in a trial, outbound and inbound.

click here to see Country codes

destinationControlDetail.description: Use this object to specify the appropriate destination control statement type(s). Also make sure to specify destination country and end user.

b13AFilingOption.description: Specify the filing option being exercised. Required for  non-document shipments originating in Canada destinated for any country other than Canada, the United States, Puerto Rico, or the U.S. Virgin Islands.

exportComplianceStatement.description:
For shipments requiring an EEI, enter the ITN number received from AES when you filed your shipment or the FTR (Foreign Trade Regulations) exemption number.The proper format for an ITN number is AES XYYYYMMDDNNNNNN where YYYYMMDD is date and NNNNNN are numbers generated by the AES.

Note: The ITN or FTR exemption number you submit in the Ship request prints on the international shipping label.

permitNumber.description:
This is a Permit Number. This field is applicable only to Canada export non-document shipments of any value to any destination. No special characters are allowed.
Example: 12345

exportDetail.description: These are export Detail used for US or CA exports.

totalCustomsValue.description: This is the total customs value.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

partiesToTransactionAreRelated.description: Specify if the transacting parties are related.

countryOfOriginLowValueDocumentRequested.description: Specify the country Of Origin of Low Value Document for Customs declaration.

customsRole.description: Specify the shipper role for Customs declaration.

usmcaLowValueStatementDetail.description: Specify the low Value statement necessary for printing the USMCA for Customs documentation.

declarationStatementDetail.description: Specifies about the statements to be declared for Customs.

insuranceCharge.description:
Specify insurance charges if applicable.
Note: FedEx does not provide insurance of any kind.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

customsClearanceDetail.description:
These are customs clearance details.
Required for International and intra-country Shipments.

ancillaryEndorsement.description:
Indicate the type of ancillary endorsement. Is required for Presorted Standard but not for returns or parcel select.
Note: Not all are usable for all ancillary endorsements.
For more information, refer to the FedEx SmartPost®.

hubId.description:
Specify the four-digit numeric Hub ID value used for smartport shipments.
click here to see Hub Ids

indicia.description:
Specify the indicia type.
Available options include:
  • MEDIA_MAIL
  • PARCEL_SELECT (1 LB through 70 LB)
  • PRESORTED_BOUND_PRINTED_MATTER
  • PRESORTED_STANDARD (less than 1 LB)
  • PARCEL_RETURN

specialServices.description: Specify the special handling associated with Smartpost Shipment.

smartPostInfoDetail.description:
Use this object to specify the smartpost shipment details.
Required for SMARTPOST service. If SmartPostInfoDetail is indicated, the elements below it are also required.

blockInsightVisibility.description: Indicate if the shipment be available to be visible/tracked using FedEx InSight<sup>®</sup> tool. If value indicated as true, only the shipper/payer will have visibility of this shipment in the FedEx InSight<sup>®</sup> tool.

labelFormatType.description:
Specify the label Format Type.
click here to see label format types

labelOrder.description: This is the order of the Shipping label/documents to be generated.

maskedData.description:
Specify which data/sections on the label to be masked.
Note:
  • SECONDARY_BARCODE – This is used for Smartpost shipment labels.
  • SHIPPER_INFORMATION – This is used for Third Party Consignee, Intra-UK shipments.
  • TOTAL_WEIGHT – This replaces the Total weight with Actual Weight in Master label and AWB copies.

regulatoryLabels.description: Specify how the regulatory details to be provided on the labels.

generationOptions.description: Specify the regulatory content preference to be displayed on the label.

type.description: Specify the type of regulatory content to be added on the label.

additionalLabels.description: Specify how the additional details to be provided on the labels.

type.description: Specify the type of additional  details to be added on the label.

count.description: Specifies the count of label to return.

docTabContentType.description: Indicates the content type of the doc tab.

docTabZoneSpecifications.description: Indicate the doc tab specifications for the individual doc tab zone on the label.

zoneNumber.description:
It is a non-negative integer that represents the portion of doc-tab in a label.
Example: 1

header.description:
Indicates the parameter name in the header for the doc tab zone.
Example: WHT

dataField.description:
Indicate the path request/reply element to be printed on doc tab.
Example:
  • REQUEST/SHIPMENT/ShipTimestamp
  • REQUEST/PACKAGE/weight/Value
  • REQUEST/PACKAGE/InsuredValue/Amount
  • REQUEST/SHIPMENT/SpecialServicesRequested/CodDetail/CodCollectionAmount/Amount

  • REPLY/PACKAGE/RATE/ACTUAL/NetCharge/AmountREPLY
  • /SHIPMENT/RATES/PAYOR_ACCOUNT/TotalSurcharges/Amount

customerSpecifiedDetail.description: This object allows the control of label content for customization.

personName.description:
Specify contact person name.
Recommended length is 70.
Note: There's no specific validation for the person name.
Example: John Taylor

emailAddress.description:
Specify contact email address. Maximum length is 80.
Example: sample@company.com

phoneNumber.description:
Specify contact phone number.
Minimum length is 10 and supports maximum of 15 for certain countries using longer phone numbers.
Note: Recommended Maximum length is 15 and there's no specific validation will be done for the phone number.
Example: 918xxxxx890

phoneExtension.description:
Specify contact phone extension.
Note: Recommended length is 6. There's no specific validation for the phone extension.
Example: 1234

faxNumber.description:
Specify contact fax number.
Note: Recommended length is 15. There's no specific validation for the fax number.
Example: 1234567890

companyName.description:
Specify contact company name.
Recommended length is 35.
Note: There's no specific validation for the company name.

contact.description: Indicate the contact details of the shipper.

streetLines.description:
This is the combination of number, street name, etc.
Note: At least one line is required and streetlines more than 3 will be ignored. Empty lines should not be included. Maximum length per line is 35.
Example: [10 FedEx Parkway, Suite 302, .etc.]

This is a placeholder for City Name.
Note: This is conditional and not required in all the requests.
Note: It is recommended for Express shipments for the most accurate ODA and OPA surcharges.

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.
Example: CA

postalCode.description:
Indicate the Postal code. This is Optional for non postal-aware countries. Maximum length is 10.
Example: 65247

countryCode.description:
This is the two-letter country code.
Maximum length is 2.
Example: US

rateRequestType.description:
Indicate the type of rates to be returned. The account specific rates are returned by default if the account number is specified in the request.
Following are values:
  • LIST - Returns FedEx published list rates in addition to account-specific rates (if applicable).
  • INCENTIVE - This is one-time discount for incentivising the customer. For more information, contact your FedEx representative.
  • ACCOUNT - Returns account specific rates (Default).
  • PREFERRED - Returns rates in the preferred currency specified in the element preferredCurrency.
  • RETAIL - Returns customer rate from one of retail FedEx service centers.
Examples: ["ACCOUNT", "PREFERRED"]

preferredCurrency.description:
Indicate the currency the caller requests to have used in all returned monetary values. Should be Used in conjunction with the element RateRequestType.
Example: USD
click here to see available Currency codes
Note: Incorrect currency codes should not be supplied. The system ignores the incorrect currency code.

totalPackageCount.description:
For an MPS, this is the total number of packages in the shipment.Applicable for parent shipment for one label at a time shipments.
Example: 25

formId.description:
This is FedEx tracking Identifier associated with the package.
Example: 8600

trackingIdType.description:
Specify the FedEx transportation type.
Example: EXPRESS

uspsApplicationId.description:
Specify the USPS tracking Identifier associated with FedEx SmartPost shipment.
Example: 92

trackingNumber.description:
This is the number associated with the package that is used to track it.For child shipment of an oneLabelAtATime shipments,this should be same as the masterTrackingNumber of the parent shipment.
Example: 49XXX0000XXX20032835

masterTrackingId.description: Indicates the tracking details of the package.Required for child shipments of an oneLabelAtATime shipments

requestedPackageLineItems.description:
These are one or more package-attribute descriptions, each of which describes an individual package, a group of identical packages, or (for the total-piece-total-weight case) common characteristics of all packages in the shipment.
  • At least one instance containing the weight for at least one package is required for EXPRESS and GROUND shipments.
  • Single piece requests will have one RequestedPackageLineItem.
  • Multiple piece requests will have multiple RequestedPackageLineItems.
  • Maximum occurrences is 30.

sequenceNumber.description:
Optional.
Used only with individual packages as a unique identifier of each requested package. Will be adjusted at the shipment level as pieces are added.

subPackagingType.description:
Indicate the subPackagingType, if you are using your own packaging for the shipment. Use it for all shipments inbound to Canada (CA) and inbound shipments to the U.S. and Puerto Rico (PR) from Canada and Mexico (MX).subPackagingType is mandatory for shipments to Canada.
Example: TUBE, CARTON, CONTAINER. etc.
Note: If the value is TUBE, a non-machinable surcharge will be applicable for SmartPost shipments.
click here to see Sub-Packaging Types
For more information on physical packaging or packaging regulatory requirements, contact your FedEx representative.

customerReferences.description: This object lists the customer references provided with the package.

customerReferenceType.description:
This is a customer reference type. The value specified here for the element is printed on the Commercial Invoice only for tracking and label information.

Note:

  • The P_O_NUMBER value must be specified in customerReferences under requestedPackageLineItems
  • The INVOICE_NUMBER value that is printed on the FedEx-supplied invoice must be specified in customerReferences under commercialInvoice. Value defined in this section will print on the label that is attached to the package
Note: INTRACOUNTRY_REGULATORY_REFERENCE is applicable only in Intra-Brazil.
For more information, click here for Cutsomer References

value.description:
This is a customer reference type value.
Example: 3686
Note: Maximum length for all customer references is 40 characters.

declaredValue.description: This is the Declared Value of any shipment which represents FedEx maximum liability associated with a shipment. This is including, but not limited to any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information related to the Shipment.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

units.description: Indicate the weight unit type. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
This is the weight. Maximum length is 99999.
Example: 68.25

weight.description:
These are the package weight details.
Note: Weight is not required for One rate shipments

dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

units.description:
Indicate the Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are:
  • IN - inches
  • CM - centimeters
    • Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.

allOf.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

groupPackageCount.description:
Indicate the grouped package count. These are number of identical package(s) each with one or more commodities.
Example: 2

itemDescriptionForClearance.description: Describe the content of the package for customs clearance purposes. This applies to intra-UAE, intra-Columbia and intra-Brazil shipments.

contentRecord.description: Use this object to specify package content details.

itemNumber.description: This is a package item number.

receivedQuantity.description: This is the package item quantity.

description.description: This is the description of the package item.

items.description: Use this object to specify package content details.

itemDescription.description:
This the item description for the package.
Note: Item description is required for Email Label return shipments and ground Create tag.
Example: Item description
Maximum limit is 50 characters

rateType.description: This is the rate type used for this package.

percentValue.description:
This is the variable handling percentage. If the percent value is mentioned as 10, it means 10%(multiplier of 0.1).
Example: 12.45

rateLevelType.description: Specifies if the rate level type is either Individual or Bundled.

fixedValue.description:
This is to specify a fixed handling charge on the shipment. The element allows entry of 7 characters before the decimal and 2 characters following the decimal.
Example: 5.00.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

fixed variable handling charge currency type
click here to see Currency codes

rateElementBasis.description: Specify the charge type upon which the variable handling percentage amount is calculated.

variableHandlingChargeDetail.description: Indicate the details about how to calculate variable handling charges at the shipment level. They can be based on a percentage of the shipping charges or a fixed amount. If indicated, element rateLevelType is required.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Indicate the types of special services requested for the shipment.
click here to see Package Special Service Types

signatureOptionType.description:
Indicate the Signature Type.
Valid Values:
  • ADULT - Adult signature required, at recipient address.
  • DIRECT - Signature required, at recipient address.
  • INDIRECT - Signature required, alternate address is accepted.This option is available for residential deliveries only
  • NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED - Signature is not required.
  • SERVICE_DEFAULT - Signature handled as per current Service Guide.

enhancementTypes.description:
The types of all enhancement for the Priority Alert.
Example: PRIORITY_ALERT_PLUS

content.description: Specifies Content for the Priority Alert Detail.

signatureOptionDetail.description: This element specifies Signature option details.

alcoholRecipientType.description:
Specify the Alcohol Recipient Type of the shipment.
Example:
  • LICENSEE- FedEx approved alchol shipper having appropriate licenses.
  • CONSUMER- Individual consumer to whom the alchol is shipped.

shipperAgreementType.description: Specify the type of entity, the shipper for alcohol shipment is registered such as fulfillment house, retailer or a winery.

alcoholDetail.description: These are detcontentails for the package containing alcohol. This is required for alcohol special service. The alcoholRecipientType is required.

accessibility.description:
Specify Dangerous Goods Accessibility Type.
  • Inaccessible – it does not have to be accessable on the aircraft.
  • Accessible – it must be fully accessible on the aircraft, and is more strictly controlled.

options.description: Indicate type of DG being reported.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

packageCODDetail.description: These are COD package details. For use with FedEx Ground services only; COD must be present in shipments special services.

batteryDetails.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

batteryPackingType.description: Describe the packing arrangement of the battery or cell with respect to other items within the same package.

batteryRegulatoryType.description: This is a regulation specific classification for the battery or the cell.

batteryMaterialType.description: Indicate the material composition of the battery or cell.

units.description: Indicate the weight unit type. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
This is the weight. Maximum length is 99999.
Example: 68.25

dryIceWeight.description:
These are the package weight details.
Note: Weight is not required for One rate shipments

packageSpecialServices.description: These are special services that are available at the package level for some or all service types.

items.description:
These are one or more package-attribute descriptions, each of which describes an individual package, a group of identical packages, or (for the total-piece-total-weight case) common characteristics of all packages in the shipment.
  • At least one instance containing the weight for at least one package is required for EXPRESS and GROUND shipments.
  • Single piece requests will have one RequestedPackageLineItem.
  • Multiple piece requests will have multiple RequestedPackageLineItems.
  • Maximum occurrences is 30.

allOf.description: The descriptive data of the requested shipment.

readyPickupDateTime.description: Specify the time and date the package will be ready for pickup.

latestPickupDateTime.description: Specify the last possible pickup date and time.

pickupDetail.description:
Specifies the pickup details for the Tag shipment.
ReadyDateTime and LatestPickupDateTime are required.

accountNumber.description: The specific FedEx customer account number (account value) associated with the shipment.

value.description:
This is the account number. Maximum length is 9.
Example: Your account number

allOf.description: This is FedEx Account number details.
